lead_paragraph: Asbury Park, N.J., will honor the former world-record-breaking sprinter Frank Budd with a track meet named in his honor Saturday. The meet will be at Asbury Park High School, where Budd first attracted attention a half-century ago as a runner and football player. In 1962, Budd set a world record of 9.2 seconds for the 100-yard dash. He later played wide receiver and returned kickoffs for the Philadelphia Eagles and the Washington Redskins.
